channel.title: NPR Topics: World
channel.description: NPR world news, international art and culture, world business and financial markets, world economy, and global trends in health, science and technology. Subscribe to the World Story of the Day podcast and RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Suicide bombing at Islamabad mosque kills 31 people
item.description: An update on the suicide bombing in Pakistan's capital that killed 31 people.
item.content:encoded: An update on the suicide bombing in Pakistan's capital that killed 31 people.
item.dc:creator: Betsy Joles

item.title: Among U.S.-Iran tensions, concern for an Iranian-American in Evin prison
item.description: As indirect talks begin between the U.S. and Iran over that country's nuclear program, Ryan Fayhee, lawyer for journalist Abdolreza Valizadeh, talks about his concern for his client, who is being held in Evin prison in Tehran.
item.content:encoded: As indirect talks begin between the U.S. and Iran over that country's nuclear program, Ryan Fayhee, lawyer for journalist Abdolreza Valizadeh, talks about his concern for his client, who is being held in Evin prison in Tehran.
item.dc:creator: Matt Ozug

item.title: Danish vets want an apology from President Trump
item.description: Danish veterans of the war in Iraq want an apology from Trump over Greenland stance.
item.content:encoded: Danish veterans of the war in Iraq want an apology from Trump over Greenland stance.
item.dc:creator: Adrienne Murray

item.title: State Department will delete X posts from before Trump returned to office
item.description: The policy change orders the removal of any post made by official State Department accounts on X before President Trump returned to office in 2025.
item.content:encoded:
The policy change orders the removal of any post made by official State Department accounts on X before President Trump returned to office in 2025.

(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)
item.dc:creator: Shannon Bond

item.title: Mariah Carey, coffee makers and other highlights from the Olympic opening ceremony
item.description: NPR reporters at the Milan opening ceremony layered up and took notes.
item.content:encoded:
NPR reporters at the Milan opening ceremony layered up and took notes.

(Image credit: Sarah Stier)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Japan's first female prime minister stakes her future on snap elections
item.description: Japan's first female premier has called snap elections for Sunday. She seeks a mandate for what could be sweeping changes and possibly a lurch to the political right.
item.content:encoded:
Japan's first female premier has called snap elections for Sunday. She seeks a mandate for what could be sweeping changes and possibly a lurch to the political right.

(Image credit: Philip Fong)
item.dc:creator: Anthony Kuhn

item.title: Where things stand after U.S. and Iranian officials' indirect talks in Oman
item.description: The U.S. and Iran sat down for high-stakes talks as the U.S. builds up military forces in the region.
item.content:encoded: The U.S. and Iran sat down for high-stakes talks as the U.S. builds up military forces in the region.
item.dc:creator: Jackie Northam

item.title: Photos: Highlights from the Winter Olympics opening ceremony
item.description: Athletes from around the world attended the 2026 Winter Olympics opening ceremony in Milan.
item.content:encoded:
Athletes from around the world attended the 2026 Winter Olympics opening ceremony in Milan.

(Image credit: Piero Cruciatti)
item.dc:creator: Emily Bogle

item.title: Suicide bombing at a Shiite mosque on Islamabad's outskirts kills at least 31
item.description: It was a rare attack in the capital of Pakistan as its Western-allied government struggles to rein in a surge in militant attacks across the country.
item.content:encoded:
It was a rare attack in the capital of Pakistan as its Western-allied government struggles to rein in a surge in militant attacks across the country.

(Image credit: Anjum Naveed/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: U.S., Iran to hold nuclear program talks. And, Dems unveil new list of DHS demands
item.description: The U.S. and Iran begin high-stakes talks today over Iran's nuclear program. And, Democrats unveil a detailed list of demands to change how DHS immigration enforcement officers operate.
item.content:encoded:
The U.S. and Iran begin high-stakes talks today over Iran's nuclear program. And, Democrats unveil a detailed list of demands to change how DHS immigration enforcement officers operate.

(Image credit: AFP via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton
